org.apache.spark.sql.connector.write

Interface DeltaWriter<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, DataWriter<T>

    @Experimental
public interface DeltaWriter<T>
extends DataWriter<T>
    A data writer returned by DeltaWriterFactory.createWriter(int, long) and is responsible for writing a delta of rows.
    Since:
    3.4.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      void delete(T metadata, T id)
      Deletes a row.
      void insert(T row)
      Inserts a new row.
      void update(T metadata, T id, T row)
      Updates a row.
      default void write(T row)
      Writes one record.

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        void delete(T metadata,
            T id)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes a row.
        Parameters:
        metadata - values for metadata columns that were projected but are not part of the row ID
        id - a row ID to delete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if failure happens during disk/network IO like writing files

      • update

        void update(T metadata,
            T id,
            T row)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Updates a row.
        Parameters:
        metadata - values for metadata columns that were projected but are not part of the row ID
        id - a row ID to update
        row - a row with updated values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if failure happens during disk/network IO like writing files

      • insert

     throws java.io.IOException
        Inserts a new row.
        Parameters:
        row - a row to insert
        Throws:

      • write

        default void write(T row)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: DataWriter
        Writes one record.

        If this method fails (by throwing an exception), DataWriter.abort() will be called and this data writer is considered to have been failed.

        Specified by:
        write in interface DataWriter<T>
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if failure happens during disk/network IO like writing files.
